Classify EACH file in the comprehensive review list into user-facing or internal:
USER-FACING file patterns (require docs verification): 1. src/docvet/cli.py or CLI flag changes ‚Üí expects docs/site/cli-reference.md 2. src/docvet/config.py or [tool.docvet] key changes ‚Üí expects docs/site/configuration.md 3. src/docvet/checks/*.py (check behavior changes) ‚Üí expects docs/site/checks/{check_name}.md 4. Rule behavior changes ‚Üí expects docs/site/rules/{rule_name}.md 5. Public API surface changes (__all__, new modules) ‚Üí expects reference/ updates (auto-generated from docstrings) 6. User workflow changes (install, pre-commit, CI setup) ‚Üí expects README.md and/or relevant docs/site/ page
INTERNAL file patterns (NO docs required): - tests/** - .github/** (CI config, instructions, templates) - _bmad/** and _bmad-output/** - .claude/** and other IDE config (.cursor/, .windsurf/) - pyproject.toml (UNLESS config key changes in [tool.docvet]) - Internal refactoring with no behavior change
Collect the set of EXPECTED docs pages based on which user-facing patterns matched.
Extract the story's Dev Notes ‚Üí Documentation Impact section: - Read the "Pages:" field (concrete page paths or "None ‚Äî no user-facing changes") - Read the "Nature of update:" field

Compare file classification results against story's Documentation Impact:
CASE 1 ‚Äî Documentation Impact section is missing or empty: ‚Üí MEDIUM finding: "Documentation Impact section missing ‚Äî every story must declare affected pages or 'None'"
CASE 2 ‚Äî Story says "None" but changed files include user-facing source code: ‚Üí HIGH finding: "Documentation Impact says 'None' but PR modifies user-facing files: {list files}. Expected docs updates: {expected pages from decision tree}"
CASE 3 ‚Äî Story lists specific pages but those pages are NOT in the File List (not actually updated): ‚Üí HIGH finding: "Documentation Impact lists {pages} but these were not updated in the PR. Either update the docs or explain why in a completion note"
CASE 4 ‚Äî Story lists pages AND those pages appear in the File List: ‚Üí No finding (docs were planned and delivered)
CASE 5 ‚Äî Story says "None" AND all changed files are internal (tests, CI, BMAD, config): ‚Üí No finding (correctly classified as no user-facing impact)
CASE 6 ‚Äî File classification identifies expected docs pages NOT listed in Documentation Impact: ‚Üí MEDIUM finding: "Changed files suggest docs updates to {expected pages} but Documentation Impact doesn't list them"

For EACH file in comprehensive review list: 1. **Security**: Look for injection risks, missing validation, auth issues 2. **Performance**: N+1 queries, inefficient loops, missing caching 3. **Error Handling**: Missing try/catch, poor error messages 4. **Code Quality**: Complex functions, magic numbers, poor naming 5. **Test Quality**: Are tests real assertions or placeholders?

For EACH modified src/ file in the comprehensive review list: 1. Read the file content 2. Run analyze_code_snippet MCP tool with projectKey "docvet" and language "py" 3. Report any HIGH or BLOCKER severity findings as review issues 4. Note cognitive complexity warnings (threshold: 15) as MEDIUM findings 5. If SonarQube server is unreachable (off-LAN), skip gracefully and note in review
